event_registry_properties.name: action
event_registry_properties.item: Schedule a repair procedure to replace the affected CPU. Use 'fmadm faulty' to identify the module.
event_registry_properties.name: description
event_registry_properties.item: The number of errors associated with this CPU has exceeded acceptable levels.
event_registry_properties.name: details
event_registry_properties.item:
Step 4: Verify the CPU is in use by the system.

To verify that the CPU has been returned to service, use the Solaris command psrinfo (1M). See Example 4.1 below.

    Example 4.1 - verifying the CPU has returned to service: 
    # psrinfo
0       on-line   since 09/22/2008 14:45:16
1       on-line   since 09/22/2008 14:44:19
2       on-line   since 09/22/2008 14:44:57
3       on-line   since 09/22/2008 14:44:23
event_registry_properties.name: impact
event_registry_properties.item: Performance of this system may be affected.
event_registry_properties.name: response
event_registry_properties.item: An attempt will be made to remove this CPU from service.
event_registry_properties.name: title
